isis.stitle: FAN DRIVE CLUTCH: HORTON ON/OFF - MAINTENANCE - PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE

step1.para: Inspect all electrical connections and wires. Tighten if loose; replace if damaged.
Disconnect (+) terminal of thermal switch to verify clutch engagement.

note.para: Engine temperature must be below thermal switch engaging temperature. (When using N.O. thermal switch, install jumper wire between thermal switch terminals.)

step1.para: Check all air connections for air leaks.
Check friction facing for wear. Replace when worn to 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) thick ( Figure 2).

figure.caption: Figure 2. Locations to Apply Bubble Solution For Checking Air Leaks

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. AROUND COME-HOME BOLT HOLES IN PISTON FRICTION DISC
2. BETWEEN AIR CHAMBER AND PISTON FRICTION DISC
3. ON BLEED HOLE ON FAN PILOT

step1.para: Check for air leaks in fan clutch. Turn engine off and lightly brush a bubble solution on bleed hole on fan pilot between air chamber and piston friction disc, and around come-home bolt holes on piston friction disc ( Figure 2).

step2.para: Air leaks from bleed hole (Item 3, Figure 2) in fan pilot indicate faulty cartridge assembly or face seal.
Air leaks around air chamber and piston friction disc (Item 2) indicate faulty large O-ring seal.
Air leaks from come-home holes (Item 1) indicate faulty small O-ring seal.

important.para: Bearings and seals should be replaced every 350,000 miles.
